reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-6654: Performance improvement of auto evaluation of Decision Days - related to MTI

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Why do these need to be BigDecimals?

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
Hello Aisling, As discussed getMinimumTimeIncrement() had been returning BigDecimal due to some reason. I checked with Mark who had done the implmentation of this earlier. May be one of the method that gives the MTI values from LeavePlanEntitlement or from agreement was returning BigDecimal. But they both return long now.
I am droping this comment as part of this review. But creating a Technical debt to fix that Big Decimal issue as soon as possible. Hope that is ok. Jira Technical debt created - FAB-6684

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-6472 Consider both \'Approved\' and \'Time Available\' Days while calculating Projected Balance

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: Update javadoc to consider the Approved status as well.

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: updated the javadoc

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment:
This attribute has the same values as the permittedDecisionStatuses class attribute. Why not use it here too?
Also, the "permittedDecisionStatuses" should be a constant, be place on top of the class, not in the middle and just wondering if it shouldn't be a subset...

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: Yes good catch ... I should have put it at top and made as a cosntant .. We cannot make this as a subset because we are using these statuses to ftech some data from queries only ... In some cases we are giving only TIME_AVAILABLE .. Both TIME_AVAILABLE and APPROVED in some .. So I feel subset is not requried here

comments.author: Daniel Delgado
comments.comment: Fair enough.

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: Approved status should also be considered here? This is also calculating projected balance for all the decision days in leave request.

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: Included Approved status as well

comments.comment: Name the variable with capital letters because it is a constant.
